content.rendered:
ABOUT US

EARTHRISE

Our inspiration is the iconic picture “Earthrise”, which shows the Earth rising above the moon, and was sent to Earth by the astronauts of the Apollo 8 mission on Christmas Eve 1968. They flew into space in order to explore the moon, and instead they discovered the Earth. The picture went around the world and became a symbol for spaceship Earth and the vulnerability of our planet. Many people saw the earth as a fragile sphere shrouded in its atmosphere, traversing the cosmos all alone, and it dawned on them: The unsustainable exploitation and threat to this world’s resources must be stopped. In order to achieve this, humanity needs a more comprehensive understanding and data connectivity of the Earth.

RFA has established a dedicated team of space enthusiasts and NewSpace experts from 30 different nationalities having a demonstrated track record from previous small launcher projects. 

Founded

2018

Team Members

220

Nationalities

30

Our Story

2018
  • Established in 2018 as a corporate spinoff from OHB, via MT Aerospace Holding.
2019
  • Conversion into a public limited company. Stefan Brieschenk  and Jörn Spurmann become board members and co-founders.
  • Qualification of upper stage tank and in-house development of turbopump.
2020
  • Inauguration of test-site & securing public funding. Final negotiations of the launch sites.
2021
  • 8 seconds hot fire test and qualification of the main engine. Cryogenic pressure test and qualification of the first stage.
2022
  • A total of 74 seconds hot fired test of the Helix in flight configuration without the need to replace any components of the engine.

RFA has established a dedicated team of space enthusiasts and NewSpace experts from 30 different nationalities having a demonstrated track record from previous small launcher projects.

  • Qualification of upper stage tank and in-house development of turbopump.

  • Inauguration of test-site & securing public funding. Final negotiations of the launch sites.
2021
  • 8 seconds hot fire test and qualification of the main engine. Cryogenic pressure test and qualification of the first stage.
2022
  • A total of 74 seconds hot fired test of the Helix in flight configuration without the need to replace any components of the engine.

One Team, One Goal, RFA ONE

Space enthusiasts from around the world working together in Germany, Portugal and Sweden for the same goal.
